org.soulwing.prospecto.api.listener

Interface ViewNodeAcceptor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ViewListener

    public interface ViewNodeAcceptor
extends ViewListener
    A listener that is notified before nodes are visited during a view processing lifecycle.

    When generating a view or applying a view to update a model, the ViewNodeAcceptor instances registered with the view context are consulted for each node in the view template's node tree. In the order in which they are registered, each acceptor is given an opportunity to allow or deny the visitation of a given node. If all acceptors return true from the shouldVisitNode(ViewNodeEvent) method, the node is visited. The first registered acceptor to return false effectively vetoes the visitation of the node, and no other acceptors are consulted.

    A listener of this type can be used to filter subtrees from a generated view, or to ignore subtrees of a view provided as input when a view is applied to update a model. If an acceptor vetoes the visitation of a given node, none of the descendants of that node will be visited during view processing.

    The event object passed to the listener methods identifies the subject view template node for the event. During view generation, the model property of the event is the model object that corresponds to the parent of the subject node. During view application, the model property of the event is a ViewEntity that represents an instance of the object type that corresponds to the parent of the subject node.

    Author:
    Carl Harris

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean shouldVisitNode(ViewNodeEvent event)
      Notifies the recipient that a view node will be visited.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldVisitNode

        boolean shouldVisitNode(ViewNodeEvent event)
        Notifies the recipient that a view node will be visited.
        Parameters:
        event - event describing the node
        Returns:
        true if this filter wishes to allow the node to be visited
